name: treasure
content:
treasure noun
(VALUABLE THINGS)

B2 [ U ] very valuable things, usually in the form of a store of precious metals, precious stones, or money: buried treasure Stories about pirates often include a search for buried treasure. When they opened up the tomb they found treasure beyond their wildest dreams. treasures C2 [ plural ]
very valuable things, especially pieces of art: art treasures At the time, the painting was considered one of the world's greatest art treasures.

treasure noun
(PERSON)
[ C ] mainly UK informal someone who is very helpful and valuable to you: I don't know what I'd have done without Lizzie when I was ill - she was an absolute treasure.
[ C ] mainly UK old-fashioned informal a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a child: Come on, treasure, let's go and see Granny.
